channel.title: CVE Feed for Eclipse Foundation -- Jetty
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Eclipse Foundation -- Jetty

item.title: CVE-2024-6763|2024-10-14T15:30:38.815Z -- eclipse%20foundation -- jetty
item.description:
Eclipse Jetty is a lightweight, highly scalable, Java-based web server and Servlet engine . It includes a utility class, HttpURI, for URI/URL parsing.
The HttpURI class does insufficient validation on the authority segment of a URI. However the behaviour of HttpURI differs from the common browsers in how it handles a URI that would be considered invalid if fully validated against the RRC. Specifically HttpURI and the browser may differ on the value of the host extracted from an invalid URI and thus a combination of Jetty and a vulnerable browser may be vulnerable to a open redirect attack or to a SSRF attack if the URI is used after passing validation checks.

item.title: CVE-2024-8184|2024-10-14T15:30:02.698Z -- eclipse%20foundation -- jetty
item.description: There exists a security vulnerability in Jetty's ThreadLimitHandler.getRemote() which can be exploited by unauthorized users to cause remote denial-of-service (DoS) attack. By repeatedly sending crafted requests, attackers can trigger OutofMemory errors and exhaust the server's memory.

item.title: CVE-2024-9823|2024-10-14T15:29:14.390Z -- eclipse%20foundation -- jetty
item.description: There exists a security vulnerability in Jetty's DosFilter which can be exploited by unauthorized users to cause remote denial-of-service (DoS) attack on the server using DosFilter. By repeatedly sending crafted requests, attackers can trigger OutofMemory errors and exhaust the server's memory finally.

item.title: CVE-2024-6762|2024-10-14T15:07:10.942Z -- eclipse%20foundation -- jetty
item.description: Jetty PushSessionCacheFilter can be exploited by unauthenticated users to launch remote DoS attacks by exhausting the serverâ€™s memory.
